modules.title: Fire Safety Basics
modules.description: Learn fundamental fire safety principles for educational institutions
learning_objectives: Identify common fire hazards in schools

questions.question: What are the three elements needed for fire to exist?
questions.explanation: The fire triangle consists of fuel (combustible material), oxygen, and heat (ignition source).

questions.question: You should use elevators during a fire emergency.
questions.explanation: Never use elevators during fires as they may malfunction or trap you.

questions.question: What should you do if you hear the fire alarm?
options: Immediately stop what you're doing and evacuate
Look for the fire before leaving
questions.explanation: Always evacuate immediately when the fire alarm sounds, following established evacuation routes.

modules.title: Earthquake Response Procedures
modules.description: Essential earthquake safety and response techniques for schools and colleges

questions.question: What should you do FIRST when you feel earthquake shaking?
questions.explanation: The first step in Drop, Cover, Hold On is to immediately drop to your hands and knees.

questions.question: It's safe to stand under a doorway during an earthquake.
questions.explanation: Doorways are not safer than other locations and may not provide adequate protection from falling objects.

emergency_protocols.title: School Fire Emergency Protocol

protocol_steps.title: Discovery and Alarm
protocol_steps.description: Anyone discovering a fire should immediately activate the nearest fire alarm pull station

protocol_steps.title: Notification
protocol_steps.description: Fire alarm system notifies all occupants and automatically contacts fire department

protocol_steps.title: Evacuation
protocol_steps.description: All occupants evacuate using nearest safe exit route

evacuation_routes: Primary Route A: Main entrance via central hallway
Primary Route B: East exit via gymnasium
Secondary Route A: West exit via cafeteria
